packages.name: 1-Day Trip to Galle

activities.description: Depart from your accommodation early to make the most of your day. Ensure you have your surfing gear and beach essentials packed.
Enjoy a hearty breakfast at one of the local cafes or restaurants in Galle. Recommended spots include Pedlar's Inn Cafe and Church Street Social.
Head to Unawatuna Beach, a short drive from Galle. Unawatuna is renowned for its beautiful crescent-shaped beach and good surfing conditions, especially for beginners and intermediate surfers.

Take a short break and explore the historic Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Walk along the ramparts, visit the Galle Lighthouse and the Maritime Museum, and shop for souvenirs in the quaint shops.
Have lunch at a restaurant within Galle Fort or nearby. Recommended spots include The Fort Printers and Lucky Fort Restaurant.

Drive to Jungle Beach, located near Unawatuna. It's a smaller, more secluded beach with calm waters, perfect for relaxing after your morning surf session. Enjoy swimming, snorkeling, or just lounging on the beach.
Head to Weligama Bay, about a 30-minute drive from Galle, for more surfing. Weligama is famous for its long sandy beach and consistent waves, suitable for all levels of surfers.
Relax on the beach and enjoy the stunning sunset over the Indian Ocean. It's a perfect way to end your day of beach activities.
Have dinner at one of the beachfront restaurants in Weligama. Recommended spots include W15 Weligama and Nomad Café & Boutique.
Travel back to Galle or your accommodation, reflecting on a fun-filled day of surfing and beach activities.

tips: Consider hiring a tuk-tuk or a car for the day to make traveling between locations easier.
Always follow local guidelines for swimming and surfing. Be aware of the tides and currents.
Bring sunscreen, a hat, and plenty of water to stay hydrated throughout the day.

packages.name: 2-Day Trip to Galle

activities.description: Depart from your accommodation early to make the most of your day. Ensure you have your surfing gear and beach essentials packed.
Enjoy a hearty breakfast at one of the local cafes or restaurants in Galle. Recommended spots include Pedlar's Inn Cafe and Church Street Social.
Head to Unawatuna Beach, a short drive from Galle. Unawatuna is renowned for its beautiful crescent-shaped beach and good surfing conditions, especially for beginners and intermediate surfers.

Take a short break and explore the historic Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Walk along the ramparts, visit the Galle Lighthouse and the Maritime Museum, and shop for souvenirs in the quaint shops.
Have lunch at a restaurant within Galle Fort or nearby. Recommended spots include The Fort Printers and Lucky Fort Restaurant.

Drive to Jungle Beach, located near Unawatuna. It's a smaller, more secluded beach with calm waters, perfect for relaxing after your morning surf session. Enjoy swimming, snorkeling, or just lounging on the beach.
Head to Weligama Bay, about a 30-minute drive from Galle, for more surfing. Weligama is famous for its long sandy beach and consistent waves, suitable for all levels of surfers.
Relax on the beach and enjoy the stunning sunset over the Indian Ocean. It's a perfect way to end your day of beach activities.
Have dinner at one of the beachfront restaurants in Weligama. Recommended spots include W15 Weligama and Nomad Café & Boutique.
Enjoy breakfast at your accommodation or a local café in Galle.
Drive to Mirissa, about a 45-minute drive from Galle. Mirissa is another great surfing spot with beautiful beaches.
Join a whale watching tour in Mirissa, known for its sightings of blue whales, sperm whales, and dolphins.
Have lunch at a beachfront restaurant in Mirissa. Recommended spots include Zephyr Restaurant & Bar and Margherita Italiano Restaurant.
Relax on Mirissa Beach, swim, or snorkel. Mirissa Beach is known for its picturesque scenery and calm waters.
On your way back to Galle, visit Koggala Lake. Enjoy a boat ride and explore the small islands on the lake.
Return to Galle for dinner. Recommended spots include A Minute by Tuk Tuk and The Tuna & The Crab.

tips: Book your whale watching tour in advance to ensure availability.
Bring a waterproof camera for underwater and whale watching photos.
Stay hydrated and protect yourself from the sun with sunscreen and a hat.

packages.name: 3-Day Trip to Galle

activities.description: Depart from your accommodation early to make the most of your day. Ensure you have your surfing gear and beach essentials packed.
Enjoy a hearty breakfast at one of the local cafes or restaurants in Galle. Recommended spots include Pedlar's Inn Cafe and Church Street Social.
Head to Unawatuna Beach, a short drive from Galle. Unawatuna is renowned for its beautiful crescent-shaped beach and good surfing conditions, especially for beginners and intermediate surfers.

Take a short break and explore the historic Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Walk along the ramparts, visit the Galle Lighthouse and the Maritime Museum, and shop for souvenirs in the quaint shops.
Have lunch at a restaurant within Galle Fort or nearby. Recommended spots include The Fort Printers and Lucky Fort Restaurant.

Drive to Jungle Beach, located near Unawatuna. It's a smaller, more secluded beach with calm waters, perfect for relaxing after your morning surf session. Enjoy swimming, snorkeling, or just lounging on the beach.
Head to Weligama Bay, about a 30-minute drive from Galle, for more surfing. Weligama is famous for its long sandy beach and consistent waves, suitable for all levels of surfers.
Relax on the beach and enjoy the stunning sunset over the Indian Ocean. It's a perfect way to end your day of beach activities.

Enjoy breakfast at your accommodation or a local café in Galle.
Drive to Mirissa, about a 45-minute drive from Galle. Mirissa is another great surfing spot with beautiful beaches.
Join a whale watching tour in Mirissa, known for its sightings of blue whales, sperm whales, and dolphins.
Have lunch at a beachfront restaurant in Mirissa. Recommended spots include Zephyr Restaurant & Bar and Margherita Italiano Restaurant.
Relax on Mirissa Beach, swim, or snorkel. Mirissa Beach is known for its picturesque scenery and calm waters.
On your way back to Galle, visit Koggala Lake. Enjoy a boat ride and explore the small islands on the lake.
Return to Galle for dinner. Recommended spots include A Minute by Tuk Tuk and The Tuna & The Crab.
Enjoy breakfast at your accommodation or a local café in Galle.
Drive to Hikkaduwa Beach, about a 30-minute drive from Galle. Hikkaduwa is known for its coral reefs and marine life. Enjoy snorkeling or scuba diving.
Explore the local area, visit the Tsunami Honganji Vihara, and shop for souvenirs at the local markets.
Have lunch at a beachfront restaurant in Hikkaduwa. Recommended spots include Mamas Coral Beach Restaurant and Red Lobster.
Enjoy an afternoon surfing session at Hikkaduwa Beach, known for its good waves and vibrant surf culture.
Spend some time relaxing on the beach, swimming, or exploring the nearby coral reefs.
Watch the sunset from Hikkaduwa Beach, known for its beautiful evening views.
Have dinner at a beachfront restaurant in Hikkaduwa. Recommended spots include Top Secret and The Crab.
Return to your accommodation in Galle.

tips: Book your whale watching tour and scuba diving session in advance to ensure availability.
Bring a waterproof camera for underwater and whale watching photos.
Stay hydrated and protect yourself from the sun with sunscreen and a hat.

Enjoy breakfast at your accommodation or a local café in Galle.
Drive to Koggala Beach, about a 20-minute drive from Galle. Enjoy the calm waters and beautiful surroundings.
Try stilt fishing, a traditional fishing method unique to Sri Lanka, with local fishermen.
Have lunch at a beachfront restaurant in Koggala. Recommended spots include The Fortress and Café Ceylon.
Tour the Handunugoda Tea Estate, known for its 'Virgin White Tea'. Learn about tea production and enjoy a tea tasting session.
Return to Galle and spend some time shopping for souvenirs and exploring the local markets.
Have dinner at a local restaurant in Galle. Recommended spots include The Church Street Social and Elita Restaurant.
Take a leisurely evening walk in Galle Fort, enjoying the cool breeze and the historic ambiance.
Return to your accommodation, reflecting on a memorable 4-day trip.

tips: Book your whale watching tour and scuba diving session in advance to ensure availability.
Bring a waterproof camera for underwater and whale watching photos.
Stay hydrated and protect yourself from the sun with sunscreen and a hat.
